ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed my speaking and writing skills in the Hebrew language. I also learned how to analyze films and a lot about cinematography.
I was able to be in a fully Hebrew-speaking environment, work an enormous amount on my writing, and learn more correct grammar from both quizzes and Shiri's corrections.
I was given tools to analyze films through a critical lens, deepened my knowledge of Hebrew movies in particular and improved my writing skills (academic essays and weekly blog posts)

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: infinite participation opportunities because it's such a small class, kind and supportive professor in and out of class, clear assignments meant to help us grow language skills.
Weaknesses (sort of): nothing major just high level of commitment required; Shiri had me meet with a tutor outside of class as part of the course requirement which was good for my Hebrew I just had to make more time outside of class

It was a wonderful and enjoyable course. The class discussions were engaging and stimulating, the movies selected were thought-provoking, the weekly blogs helped students come prepared to class and also hone their writing skills. By cultivating multiple skills (speaking, watching, writing, reading, exposure to academic Hebrew), the class allows each student to improve their Hebrew in different ways. We mostly watched movies from the past two decades, and many of them were a bit sad (because that's the nature of much of Israeli cinema).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student. The content of the course is very interesting and it is useful for developing language and writing skills.
Yes!! Engaging, interesting, high-level Hebrew course that gave me a huge amount of exposure to Israeli film as well as improvement in Hebrew with extensive support feedback from Shiri.

Absolutely! The course was fun and interesting. The discussions were stimulating, the community of students was great, the movies were well worth watching and I believe any student can learn from the class given its emphasis on various language skills (reading, writing, watching, academic Hebrew, speaking, etc). Prof. Shiri Goren is an incredible instructor. She is highly knowledgeable, insightful, understanding and caring. I'd warmly recommend taking a class with her.
